été ajoutées ou modifiées. C’est le premier ouvrage imprimé à Strasbourg
où l’on rencontre de l'hébreu.
Schmidt I n° 66 cite outre l’exemplaire de Fribourg, un exem¬
plaire de la BN de Strasbourg, où il est introuvable. Je l’ai citée
d’après Schmidt, auquel je renvoie.
Un ex. au Catal. XX de l’Art ancien, Zurich, 1937 n° 171 pour
150 frs. suisses:, 287 leaves. With large woodcut on title, 38 fullpage
and half-page and many other woodcuts and diagrams, 1 folding plate
(musical diagrams). in-4°.... Proctor 9891. Rare second unauthorized edi¬
tion, containing for the first time the first Hebrew grammar, being also
the first book printed at Strassburg containing hebrew letters (according
to Schmidt). Smith, Rara arithmetica, p. 82... Sabin’s list, p. 2/3. Kri¬
steller N° 103 says that 29 of the cuts are new, 17 being rather exact
copies after the first edition..."
